title: 110_s1582
content: The Act titled "Hydrographic Services Improvement Act Amendments of 2008" includes definitions for various terms. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 was amended to define hydrographic data as information acquired through various surveying methods and used in providing hydrographic services. Hydrographic services include the management, interpretation, and dissemination of bathymetric, hydrographic, and other related information for the production of nautical charts and databases. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 amended to define hydrographic data as information used in producing nautical charts, databases, and nautical information systems. It also includes the development of related activities and the Coast and Geodetic Survey Act of 1947. It also includes the development of related activities and the Coast and Geodetic Survey Act of 1947. SEC. 3. FUNCTIONS OF THE ADMINISTRATOR. Section 303 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892a) is amended to include provisions for the Administrator to procure, operate vessels and equipment, and provide hydrographic services to ensure safe navigation and maintain expertise in hydrographic data acquisition. The Administrator is responsible for maintaining operational expertise in hydrographic data acquisition and services, installing real-time monitoring systems for navigation safety, acquiring data to support coastal and ocean resource management, providing services for emergencies and disasters, and collaborating with other agencies to establish joint centers. The Administrator is responsible for maintaining expertise in hydrographic data acquisition, installing monitoring systems for navigation safety, acquiring data for coastal and ocean resource management, providing services for emergencies, and collaborating with other agencies to establish joint centers. The Administrator may create and maintain joint centers with other entities as necessary and award contracts for hydrographic data acquisition in accordance with relevant laws. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to include a Hydrographic Services Review Panel consisting of 15 voting members appointed by the Administrator. Nonvoting members include the Co-directors of the Center for Coastal and Ocean Mapping/Joint Hydrographic Center and up to 2 NOAA employees. The panel members must be qualified in disciplines related to hydrographic data, marine transportation, port administration, and other relevant fields. Additionally, authorization of appropriations is amended under Section 306 of the Act. The Administrator is authorized appropriations for nautical mapping and charting functions, hydrographic surveys, contracting for surveys, operating survey vessels, and geodetic functions for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. For fiscal years 2009 to 2012, appropriations are authorized for nautical mapping, hydrographic surveys, geodetic functions, tide and current measurements, and acquiring a replacement hydrographic survey vessel. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED NOAA CORPS STRENGTH: The total number of authorized commissioned officers in the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Commissioned Officer Corps will increase from 321 to 379 effective October 1, 2009, subject to certain conditions being met.
